title: Family and Relationships
definition: Find information that may help you with a legal problem relating to your children, property or relationships.

title: Crime and offences
definition:
A crime occurs when a person breaks a law and commits an offence against the community in general or against a particular victim.

In Australia there are NSW laws and Commonwealth laws. Commonwealth laws apply in all states and territories.  These laws define offences and state a maximum penalty that a court can give you, such as a fine and/or a prison sentence if you commit the offence.

If you are charged with an offence this means you have been accused of doing something that is against the law. If you are found guilty, the magistrate or judge will then decide what penalty or punishment(sentence) you should get.

title: Debts & Money Problems
definition: Are you owed money or being chased for a debt? This topic has information for people dealing with debts

title: Neighbours
definition: Find information that may help you with a legal problem relating to your neighbours such as fencing, noise, or trees

title: Courts and Tribunals
definition:
A body that resolves disputes between parties. There are different tribunals that deal with specific matters.

For example, the NSW Civil and Administrative Tribunal (NCAT) deals with a broad and diverse range of matters from disputes about residential tenancy and building works to guardianship and administrative review of government decisions. Orders made by a tribunal are legally enforceable.

title: Motor Vehicles and Traffic Offences
definition: When a law about vehicles or road use is broken.

title: Parenting Arrangements
desc: Legal Aid NSW does give support for this legal matter.
note: You will be asked a few questions to find out what information might help and if you need legal advice.
aboutYouStep2Title: Do any of these apply to you?
YourNextStepText: Based on the information you gave, you should get legal advice
definition:
It’s usually best for everyone involved if parents can come to their own agreement, focusing on the needs and best interests of the child. Parenting agreements can be;

  • an oral agreement,
  • a written parenting plan, or
  • an agreement that is put into a formal court order, called ‘consent orders(link is external)’. This requires an application to the court.

legalGuideSections.content:
Arrangements for children

‘amica’  

amica helps separated couples to: make parenting arrangements if they have children, and divide their money and property simply. https://amica.gov.au/

title: Parenting Plan
definition: A written agreement, signed and dated by both parents, that sets out the care arrangements for a child.

title: Apprehended Violence Orders (AVOs)
definition: An order made by a court that is aimed at protecting one person or people from another person that causes them to fear for their safety.

title: Arrest
definition: To be taken into police custody for committing or being suspected of committing a criminal offence.

title: Drink Driving
desc: Legal Aid NSW does give support for this legal matter.
note: You will be asked a few questions to find out what information might help and if you need legal advice.
aboutYouStep2Title: Do any of these apply to you?
YourNextStepText: Based on the information you gave, you should get legal advice
definition:
What to do if you are pleading guilty to a drink driving charge or have received a penalty notice for drink driving.

A drink driving charge can be:

  • a 'prescribed concentration of alcohol' (PCA) offence
  • a 'driving under the influence' (DUI) offence
  • refusing or failing to give a breath analysis or blood sample, and
  • dangerous driving involving alcohol.

legalGuideFacts.desc: It looks like you have a Criminal Law problem

legalGuideSections.title: Who you can connect
legalGuideSections.content:
Call our helpline

A telephone helpline that gives free legal information, referrals to other services and legal advice in some cases. Call 1300 888 529 or visit www.lawaccess.nsw.gov.au

Get help at court on the day

On your court date there will be a duty lawyer available who can give you legal advice.

legalGuideSections.title: Where you can find more information

title: Fences
desc: Legal Aid NSW does not provide advice on this matter.
note: We can only provide you with information and contact details to other services if you require further legal support.
YourNextStepText:
Based on the information you gave, you cannot get legal advice from Legal Aid NSW.
Please use the information and alternative services for your problem.
definition:
This topic gives you information about the law on dividing fences. It also gives you information about boundary disputes and retaining walls. It can help you if:

  • you want to build, fix or replace a dividing fence
  • you have a disagreement with your neighbour about a dividing fence
  • you have a disagreement with your neighbour about where the common boundary between your properties is
  • you want to build a retaining wall.

legalGuideFacts.desc: It looks like you have a Civil Law problem

legalGuideSections.title: Who you can contact
legalGuideSections.content:
The Solicitor Referral Service of the Law Society of New South Wales

helps members of the public find a private firm of solicitors or accredited specialists in specific areas of law. 

www.lawsociety.com.au/for-the-public/going-court-and-working-with-lawyers/solicitor-referral-service

Community Justice Centres

provide quick and impartial dispute resolution services for minor matters e.g. neighbourhood disputes.    

Phone: 1800 990 777
Hours: 9am to 5pm, Monday to Friday

Community Legal Centres NSW Recommendation Service

This app will ask you a few questions to direct you to community legal centres that are suitable for your situation.

https://applications-au.neotalogic.com/a/clcnsw-recommendation-service

title: Debts Between People
desc: Legal Aid NSW does give support for this legal matter.
note: You will be asked a few questions to find out what information might help and if you need legal advice.
aboutYouStep2Title: Do any of these apply to you?
YourNextStepText: Based on the information you gave, you should get legal advice
definition:
Debts are a very common legal problem that most people experience at some stage in their life. This topic explains what you can do if you are owed money, or if someone is chasing you for money.

Debts can arise in lots of different ways:

  • Contracts
  • Gifts and private loans
  • Loans and credit cards
  • Electricity, gas, water and phone bills.
